Mastodon Forks

Introduction | Mastodon Glitch Edition

glitch-soc is a friendly fork of the open-source social media software Mastodon, with the aim of providing additional features at the risk of potentially less stable software.

Frontends for Mastodon

Web-based Frontends
note

Open these in your browser. Your mileage may vary on browser vs browser and desktop vs mobile.

The default looks a bit like Twitter. There’s also an “advanced” view that looks a bit like old TweetDeck.

Default View collapsed:: true

Advanced View collapsed:: true

Neither default is what I’d call inspiring. Here are other options I’ve played with:

Phanpy collapsed:: true

A mostly single-column view that splits boosts out from the main feed, and supports rendering and posting quote-boosts.

Semaphore

Single-column view, strong emphasis on accessibility and wellness. Semaphore is a continuation of Pinafore, which was my recommended Mastodon frontend for a while. But both of these projects are unmaintained as of 2024-04-24, so I’ll keep digging. I love the Pinafore / Semaphore approach.

GitHub - NickColley/semaphore
